description:
Section 2.1 - Implement TDD Strict Mode - Old vs New Code Comparison

Requirements:
Strict TDD enforcement gate with two-stage verification:

Stage 1 - Tests on OLD code:
- Run new tests against unmodified code
- Expected: Tests FAIL (if they pass, TDD violated)
- If PASS: Reject code, return failure

Stage 2 - Tests on NEW code:
- Run same tests against new implementation
- Expected: Tests PASS
- If FAIL: Return failure with test output

Implementation:
- Create lib/runner/gates/tdd-enforcer.js
- Function: verifyTDDStrict(testFiles, modifiedFiles)
- Git stash new code, run tests, git stash pop, run tests again
- Compare results

Files to create/modify:
- lib/runner/gates.js (update verifyTDD to call strict mode)
- Create lib/runner/gates/tdd-enforcer.js
- Add configuration option: workflow.global.strictTDD = true

Success criteria:
- TDD violations detected and rejected
- Tests must fail on old code to pass gate
- Tests must pass on new code to pass gate
- Clear error messages on TDD violation

Dependencies:
- Git operations (stash, stash pop)
- Test runner (npm test)
- Gate framework (gates.js)

description:
Section 6 - Implement Smart Context - Stack Trace Slicing

Requirements:
Advanced context distillation to create minimal prompt context:

1. Parse previous errors/logs from progress.txt
2. Extract stack trace top 10 lines only
3. Include only file paths and line numbers from stack trace
4. Remove unrelated error noise
5. Use Context Slices instead of entire files

- NOT: Entire file + 500 lines of logs
- YES: The 20 lines of code referenced in stack trace + specific error message

Example:
Instead of:
"Read entire src/api/user.js (450 lines) and fix TypeError at line 234"

Use:
"Read src/api/user.js:220-240, check line 234. Error: Cannot read property 'id' of undefined"

description:

3. Create specialized migration workflow with 5 phases

1. Additive Schema (Autonomous): Add nullable columns, safe
2. Backfill Dry-Run (Autonomous): Validate logic without writes
3. Execution (BLOCKED): Human must approve and execute
4. Constraint Enforcement (Autonomous): Add NOT NULL/FKs post-exec
5. Cleanup (Autonomous): Remove temp columns/data

description:
Section 7.3 - Implement 5-Phase Migration Workflow

Requirements:
Full implementation of specialized migration workflow with 5 phases:

Phase 1 - Additive Schema (Autonomous):
- Add nullable columns only
- Safe, non-breaking changes
- Can run without human intervention

Phase 2 - Backfill Dry-Run (Autonomous):
- Validate backfill logic without writes
- Test data transformation
- Verify performance estimates

Phase 3 - Execution (BLOCKED):
- Human must approve and execute
- Actual data modification
- Manual trigger required

Phase 4 - Constraint Enforcement (Autonomous):
- Add NOT NULL constraints post-execution
- Add foreign keys after data validated
- Finalize schema

Phase 5 - Cleanup (Autonomous):
- Remove temp columns/data
- Clean up migration artifacts
- Mark migration complete
